A **spotted jelly**, j, is a type of monster that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. Like most [jellies](/wiki/Jellies "Jellies"), it is [eyeless](/wiki/Eyeless "Eyeless"), [amorphous](/wiki/Amorphous "Amorphous"), and [sessile](/wiki/Sessile "Sessile").

A spotted jelly has a [passive attack](/wiki/Passive_attack "Passive attack") that triggers if attacked directly in melee, and deals [acid](/wiki/Acid "Acid") damage dependent on the attacker's level, with a separate 1⁄30 chance of corroding worn armor and a 1⁄6 chance of corroding the weapons and/or armor used in the attack.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)[\[4\]](#cite_note-4) Spotted jellies possess [acid resistance](/wiki/Acid_resistance "Acid resistance") and [stoning resistance](/wiki/Stoning_resistance "Stoning resistance").

A spotted jelly is [acidic](/wiki/Acidic "Acidic") to [eat](/wiki/Eat "Eat"), but eating a spotted jelly [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") or [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") cures [stoning](/wiki/Stoning "Stoning") on the first bite.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Eating a spotted jelly corpse grants temporary stoning resistance, as with all stoning-resistant monsters, and can also grant temporary acid resistance.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [3 History](#History)
- [4 Variants](#Variants)
  - [4.1 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
- [5 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)
- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

Randomly generated spotted jellies are always created hostile.

Spotted jellies appear among the random j that are part of the second [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") for [Knights](/wiki/Knight "Knight") and makes up 6⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the [Knight quest](/wiki/Knight_quest "Knight quest").

## Strategy

While very damaging when attacked in melee, spotted jellies are sessile, so [acid resistance](/wiki/Acid_resistance "Acid resistance") is rarely needed for most characters: they can be easily killed with wands, spells, disposable missiles, or any other [ranged attack](/wiki/Ranged_attack "Ranged attack") such as an [aklys](/wiki/Aklys "Aklys"), [lance](/wiki/Lance "Lance") or any [polearm](/wiki/Polearm "Polearm") - the jelly will corrode vulnerable weapons even if attacked at a distance, so be careful with metallic weapons. The [ochre jelly](/wiki/Ochre_jelly "Ochre jelly") is generally more dangerous, since it can move (albeit slowly) and [engulf](/wiki/Engulf "Engulf") you.

Spotted jellies can be nasty obstacles for pets and polyforms with multiple attacks - pets should be kept out of range if at all possible, especially if a [magic whistle](/wiki/Magic_whistle "Magic whistle") or similar item is available. [Mind flayer](/wiki/Mind_flayer "Mind flayer") pets in particular are especially vulnerable to passives like that of the spotted jelly, and a character keeping one may consider an [alchemy smock](/wiki/Alchemy_smock "Alchemy smock"), [yellow dragon scales](/wiki/Yellow_dragon_scales "Yellow dragon scales"), or [yellow dragon scale mail](/wiki/Yellow_dragon_scale_mail "Yellow dragon scale mail") for them.

Spotted jellies are notable as a stoning cure for [vegan](/wiki/Vegan "Vegan") and [vegetarian](/wiki/Vegetarian "Vegetarian") characters, and may be worth using a blessed [tinning kit](/wiki/Tinning_kit "Tinning kit") on for this purpose - a blessed tin can still take an action to open, so those opting to use them should have them ready to open as soon as possible.

## History

The spotted jelly first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

## Variants

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), spotted jellies are [vulnerable](/wiki/Vulnerable "Vulnerable") to [fire](/wiki/Fire "Fire"). This also applies to [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM").

## Encyclopedia entry

- *See the [encyclopedia entry for blue jelly](/wiki/Blue_jelly#Encyclopedia_entry "Blue jelly").*

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/uhitm.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 2776](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/uhitm.c#L2776): *case for acid passive against you*
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/uhitm.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 2785](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/uhitm.c#L2785): *acid passive corrosion against you*
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/mhitm.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1072](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mhitm.c#L1072): *case for acid passive against monsters*
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/mhitm.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1072](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mhitm.c#L1072): *acid passive corrosion against monsters*

Spotted jelly

From NetHackWiki

j spotted jelly
Difficulty 6
Attacks Passive 0d6 acid
j spotted jelly
Difficulty 6
Attacks

Passive 0d6 acid

Base level 5
Base experience 61
Speed 0
Base AC 8
Base MR 10
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 50
Nutritional value 20
Size Medium
Resistances Acid, stoning
Resistances conveyed none

A spotted jelly:

  • can flow under doors.
  • does not breathe.
  • cannot pick up items.
  • has no eyes.
  • has no limbs.
  • has no head.
  • is mindless.
  • is acidic to eat.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is neither male nor female.
  • is normally generated hostile.
Reference monst.c#line511

A spotted jelly, j, is a type of monster that appears in NetHack. Like most jellies, it is eyeless, amorphous, and sessile.

A spotted jelly has a passive attack that triggers if attacked directly in melee, and deals acid damage dependent on the attacker's level, with a separate 1⁄30 chance of corroding worn armor and a 1⁄6 chance of corroding the weapons and/or armor used in the attack.[1][2][3][4] Spotted jellies possess acid resistance and stoning resistance.

A spotted jelly is acidic to eat, but eating a spotted jelly corpse or tin cures stoning on the first bite.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

Eating a spotted jelly corpse grants temporary stoning resistance, as with all stoning-resistant monsters, and can also grant temporary acid resistance.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 History
  • 4 Variants
    • 4.1 EvilHack
  • 5 Encyclopedia entry
  • 6 References

Generation

Randomly generated spotted jellies are always created hostile.

Spotted jellies appear among the random j that are part of the second quest monster class for Knights and makes up 6⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the Knight quest.

Strategy

While very damaging when attacked in melee, spotted jellies are sessile, so acid resistance is rarely needed for most characters: they can be easily killed with wands, spells, disposable missiles, or any other ranged attack such as an aklys, lance or any polearm - the jelly will corrode vulnerable weapons even if attacked at a distance, so be careful with metallic weapons. The ochre jelly is generally more dangerous, since it can move (albeit slowly) and engulf you.

Spotted jellies can be nasty obstacles for pets and polyforms with multiple attacks - pets should be kept out of range if at all possible, especially if a magic whistle or similar item is available. Mind flayer pets in particular are especially vulnerable to passives like that of the spotted jelly, and a character keeping one may consider an alchemy smock, yellow dragon scales, or yellow dragon scale mail for them.

Spotted jellies are notable as a stoning cure for vegan and vegetarian characters, and may be worth using a blessed tinning kit on for this purpose - a blessed tin can still take an action to open, so those opting to use them should have them ready to open as soon as possible.

History

The spotted jelly first appears in NetHack 3.0.0.

Variants

EvilHack

In EvilHack, spotted jellies are vulnerable to fire. This also applies to Hack'EM.

Encyclopedia entry

See the encyclopedia entry for blue jelly.

References

  1. ↑ src/uhitm.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 2776: case for acid passive against you
  2. ↑ src/uhitm.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 2785: acid passive corrosion against you
  3. ↑ src/mhitm.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1072: case for acid passive against monsters
  4. ↑ src/mhitm.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1072: acid passive corrosion against monsters

A '''spotted jelly''', {{monsym|spotted jelly}}, is a type of monster that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. Like most [[jellies]], it is [[eyeless]], [[amorphous]], and [[sessile]].

A spotted jelly has a [[passive attack]] that triggers if attacked directly in melee, and deals [[acid]] damage dependent on the attacker's level, with a separate {{frac|30}} chance of corroding worn armor and a {{frac|6}} chance of corroding the weapons and/or armor used in the attack.{{refsrc|src/uhitm.c|2776|nethack=3.6.7|comment=case for acid passive against you}}{{refsrc|src/uhitm.c|2785|nethack=3.6.7|comment=acid passive corrosion against you}}{{refsrc|src/mhitm.c|1072|nethack=3.6.7|comment=case for acid passive against monsters}}{{refsrc|src/mhitm.c|1072|nethack=3.6.7|comment=acid passive corrosion against monsters}} Spotted jellies possess [[acid resistance]] and [[stoning resistance]].

A spotted jelly is [[acidic]] to [[eat]], but eating a spotted jelly [[corpse]] or [[tin]] cures [[stoning]] on the first bite.

{{upcoming|3.7.0|Eating a spotted jelly corpse grants temporary stoning resistance, as with all stoning-resistant monsters, and can also grant temporary acid resistance.}}

==Generation==
Randomly generated spotted jellies are always created hostile.

Spotted jellies appear among the random {{white|j}} that are part of the second [[quest]] [[monster class]] for [[Knight]]s and makes up {{frac|6|175}} of the monsters randomly generated on the [[Knight quest]].

==Strategy==
While very damaging when attacked in melee, spotted jellies are sessile, so [[acid resistance]] is rarely needed for most characters: they can be easily killed with wands, spells, disposable missiles, or any other [[ranged attack]] such as an [[aklys]], [[lance]] or any [[polearm]] - the jelly will corrode vulnerable weapons even if attacked at a distance, so be careful with metallic weapons. The [[ochre jelly]] is generally more dangerous, since it can move (albeit slowly) and [[engulf]] you.

Spotted jellies can be nasty obstacles for pets and polyforms with multiple attacks - pets should be kept out of range if at all possible, especially if a [[magic whistle]] or similar item is available. [[Mind flayer]] pets in particular are especially vulnerable to passives like that of the spotted jelly, and a character keeping one may consider an [[alchemy smock]], [[yellow dragon scales]], or [[yellow dragon scale mail]] for them.

Spotted jellies are notable as a stoning cure for [[vegan]] and [[vegetarian]] characters, and may be worth using a blessed [[tinning kit]] on for this purpose - a blessed tin can still take an action to open, so those opting to use them should have them ready to open as soon as possible.

==History==
The spotted jelly first appears in [[NetHack 3.0.0]].

==Variants==
===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], spotted jellies are [[vulnerable]] to [[fire]]. This also applies to [[Hack'EM]].

==Encyclopedia entry==
